result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A. Sledge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
COMMENCE FORTHWITH                      



***JOC IS AMENDED AS FOLLOWS:  TOTAL SENTENCE OF 4 YEARS 3 MONTHS; 27 MONTHS INITIAL CONFINEMENT W/CREDIT FOR 12 DAYS SERVED; 2 YEARS EXTENDED SUPERVISION ***

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling,   AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.   
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
May not have contact with Rudy L, Jordan M, Anthony M & Kendra G, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No relationship with person of opposite sex without approval of agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Amended to read 27 months initial confinement with 12 days credit and 2 years ES

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody by phone w/Atty C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Issue of sentence credit.  Court amends sentence to a total sentence of 4 years 3 months WSP:  27 months initial confinement w/credit for 12 days served; 2 years extended supervision.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 5 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 9 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs in this file and in 14CF1242 & 14CF1121, any remainder thereafter to be returned to poster.
from Defendant

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered; extradition costs ordered in the amount of $143.83 (by stipulation of deft).  SEH 6/17/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Barth states they are working toward resolution.  STC continued to 5/6/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Barth states he is new to the case and needs to meet w/ADA McNeill to ensure he has all discovery.  STC continued to 3/25/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
Atty Michael Barth

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states the deft would like new public defender representation.  Deft agrees.  Court allows Atty Lassiter to withdraw.  STC continued to 3/4/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty C Lassiter appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Lassiter states she still needs to review video with deft in the jail.  STC continued to 1/21/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Lassiter states they have been provided with global resolution offer.  JS of 12/8/14 at 9am is removed from the calendar; STC is set for 12/12/14 at 10am.  Bond continued.
to forfeit bond; filed by ADA R Delgado.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty C Lassiter appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Sarena G. appeared.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Court holds bond issue in abeyance pending decision of whether or not bond should be forfeited.
for bond modification; filed by Atty C Lassiter.
With Atty Lassiter the BBH of 10/28/14 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 11/4/14 at 8:15am.

Judge Chad Kerkman, Acting Br. 6 for today only.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 12/4/14 at 1:15.  Jury selection 12/8/14 at 9:00.  Jury trial 12/9/14 at 9:00.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 9/19/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 10/6/14 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Carmen Lassiter. Clerk LE. Case trails 14CF885. Further proceedings on 9-15-14 @ 8:15am. Bond continued.
